programmes.show_description: When her autistic son goes missing from his preschool, a worn-out mother must delve into his imagination to follow his tracks in the hope of finding him.
A mum trying to improve her life takes a job as a cleaner and stumbles upon access to illegal stock market information that could be the answer to her problem.
Two Police officers are summoned to a hospital in London to interview a man named Alexander Litvinenko, who claims to have been poisoned.
Lucy joins television presenter Ivan Yates to learn about his life as a former farmer, government minister, bookmaker and newspaper columnist.
Fi Lawson returns home to find a group of strangers moving into her house.

Comment and analysis on the big stories of the day in Ireland and abroad with a panel of guests covering the key issues.
Some of the top celebrities across Ireland are interviewed while the hosts feature knowledgeable advice on topics that cover multiple topics and industries.
Ireland AM is the longest running daytime show in Ireland. Blending a mixture of lifestyle interviews and news content, with gardening, health, food and fashion seven days a week.
A mix of celebrity interviews, entertainment news, current affairs discussions, a look at sports competitions, health columns, cooking tips and tricks, and more.
The latest national and international news stories from the Virgin Media News team, followed by sport and weather.

The clinic staff is desperate to save a Tibetan terrier that suffers from a painful eye infection; Paul and a trio of puppies go to a local hospital to visit sick children.
Judge Judy presides over her courtroom with wit and wisdom.

After getting his big break, Joey pays Chandler back; Monica and Rachel's prom video reveals Ross' feelings for Rachel, as well as Monica's former girth.
Bear spirals over his grief. Arthur pushes Laurel too far. Can Cain stop Sarah being a Dingle?
Christina urges George not to relinquish his inheritance; Jodie gives her right arm to help the Platts; Kit learns that Mal has been seriously injured; Bernie is arrested.
Lana helps Counter Terrorism Command learn more about the recent murders.
Carisi tries to protect two women taken hostage in a standoff between police and a thief. Benson and Rollins devise a plan to get everyone to safety.
Looking for a place to sleep, Joe slips Garda custody in a chaotic Emergency Department, hiding in plain sight as overworked staff battle relentless pressure.
Jo investigates when an unconscious man is found in a burning pile of fly-tipped waste.
Correspondent Sarah O'Connor delves into some of the reasons antisocial behaviour seems to be on the rise across Ireland and discusses efforts to help victims.
Fi is overwhelmed to learn of Bram's involvement in the house sale; Bram races to distance himself from the accident as he attempts to fix things between himself and Fi.

Cooper and Fry probe a brutal quarry murder in Withens, a village battling demolition plans, uncovering links to a missing woman and a secretive gang, the Border Rats.
Detectives Cooper and Fry tackle strange Peak District cases, balancing crime-solving with local folklore in this gripping crime drama based on Stephen Booths bestselling novels.
